author: Biju Sukumaran
title: Top SoCal Coastal Adventures
text:   The Santa Barbara Sailing Center offers a a range of options, from 22' boats for short day trips, to 50' foot luxury yachts for multi-day trips. The company's Double Dolphin, a catamaran capable of hosting 42 passengers, is available for private parties complete with options for live music, cocktails, and/or dinner. The Santa Barbara Sailing Center also offers sailing instruction; it's one of the largest ASA-accredited sailing schools in the nation. Cruise the waters off Channel Islands National Park and keep a lookout for the over 25 species of whales and dolphins that call the area home. Island Packers not only offers a method to get to the Channel Islands, but a running commentary of information on sightings and behavior of dolphins and whales. If you're lucky, you may even see the elusive blue whale, the largest animal that has ever existed on earth. Made a national park in 1980, Channel Islands National Park consists of 5 of the 8 Channel Islands off the coast of Southern California. Their stark landscape is home to over 2,000 species of plants and animals and offers opportunities for hiking and camping, as well as fantastic views of the surrounding landscape. courtesy flickr/Ross Deoring Explore the unique ecosystems of the Channel Islands from an ocean perspective by kayaking. Channel Islands Outfitters's naturalists and experienced kayakers will lead you on tours of Scorpion Marine Reserve and offer advice on snorkeling and hiking the surrounding area. Channel Islands Outfitters also offers private tours which include camping and dining options. Photo courtesy of Visit Santa Barbara/Jay Sinclair Take in the California coast by horse. Saddle up on Santa Barbara Beach Horseback Ride's relaxing excursion along Butterfly Beach or view the ocean from on high on their Mountains and Bluffs ride. Photo courtesy of flickr/stellalyn With riders reaching up to 60 mph, skimming the waters off Newport Beach is a thrilling way of experiencing the coast. Balboa Water Sports offers hourly single or two-person jet ski rentals off the historic Balboa Fun Zone. They also lead guided Sea-Doo tours south towards Laguna, where riders will often spot dolphins while passing through Corona del Mar, Crystal Cove, and Emerald Bay. With 10 miles of beach and consistent waves it's no wonder Huntington Beach is dubbed "Surf City USA". Toes on the Board surf shop sells classic surf wear and even offers surf lessons and beach rentals. Photo courtesy of Lydia Schrandt Test your balance and get a full body workout with standup paddleboarding on Huntington Beach. Learn from the best at Rocky Mckinnon Surfboards, where pro surfer and surfboard maker Rocky Mckinnon teaches the proper technique needed to stand up and stay up.  Share
